physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Examination revealed linear ulcerations in the inguinal folds with surrounding verrucous lesions. Widespread pustules, erosions, and erythema affecting the groin, labia majora, labia minora, perineum, and perianal area were noted. The labia majora and minora were edematous and covered with profuse, purulent discharge. Other findings included discrete, scaling, hyperkeratotic lesions on the knees and elbows, perionychial erythema and crusting on several toes, superficial ulceration under skin folds of the lower abdomen, conjunctival erythema and edema, and multiple small shallow ulcers on the buccal mucosa and soft palate.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Over the following 4 months, the patient showed improvement with resolution of conjunctivitis, decrease in skin lesions, and resolution of vulvar ulcers and verrucous lesions; however, vulvar erythema, edema, tenderness, and discharge persisted. Six weeks later, all lesions recurred and worsened after discontinuation of acitretin.
